snippet: The State Court of Criminal Appeals denied a stay on Friday for two death row inmates, saying it did not have jurisdiction — even though the State Supreme Court says it does.
abstract: Oklahoma State Court of Criminal Appeals denies a stay for death row inmates Clayton Lockett and Charles Warner, both set to be executed in April; court says it does not have jurisdiction, even though State Supreme Court says appeals court is the only court that does have such jurisdiction; men are suing state over what they call 'veil of secrecy' surrounding Oklahoma's protocol regarding source of drugs used in executions.
lead_paragraph: The State Court of Criminal Appeals denied a stay on Friday for two death row inmates, saying it did not have jurisdiction — even though the State Supreme Court says it does.

headline.main: Oklahoma: Courts Spar Over Inmates’ Suit
headline.print_headline: Oklahoma: Courts Spar Over Inmates’ Suit
